title: Does anyone even buy Frozen Heart?
body:
I remember {{item:3110}}  being one of the best tank items and had huge impact on team fights. 

Now I can't remember the last time I got the thing. I believe it was 2-3 seasons ago. Didn't get it this season, or the last and maybe in season 6, but it was still weak even then.

It used to be good because it gave 100 armour (Fucking huge and impactfull back then), 20% cdr (Only few bruiser/tank items had it),mana (Great build-path for mana hungry champions) and 25% attack speed reduction (old one). If you managed to get thins thing none of the aa champions could kill you easily if they didn't commit to some armor pen.

Now it's one of the worst tank items around. 100 armour? {{item:3075}} is better. 

Mana?{{item:3025}} and gives dmg. 

Cdr? Fuck that everything gives you cdr.

Attack speed slow? {{item:3075}} {{item:3143}}  give it too and most will kill you before the 3rd aa without hp.

replies.body: I feel like the attack speed slows are far too irrelevant in the current climate, especially considering that Guinsoo's basically shits on anything punishing attack speed since it circumvents it entirely.

attack speed slows were always irrelevant because they are so little .
I often get it on Taric when I'm against auto reliant teams.  I get it almost every game on Natuilus and Maokai in solo lanes.  I get it almost every game on Trundle jungle.

It can still be a very strong situational item. I don't understand the hate on it, personally.

I *do* wish it built out of tear... if they made if give health for mana (like archangels gives AP for mana and Muramana gives AD for mana), I think it could become an even more viable and interesting item, personally.

So something like this?

{{item:3070}}  + {{item:3105}} + 950g = 2900g

250 mana
30 armor
30 magic resist

Awe - refund 15% of mana spent

(Taking an old rune name) Celestial body - gain health equal to 10% of your mana.

Upon transforming - active - sacrifice 15% of your current health to regenerate 50% of your maximum mana over 10 seconds (120 second cooldown)

The active could be a number of different things.  I was just thinking with Taric specifically in mind :P.

> [{quoted}](name=AlienPrimate,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WLbUt63o,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-07-26T17:25:33.740+0000)

> (Taking an old rune name) Celestial body - gain health equal to 10% of your mana.


{{champion:13}} *Heavy breathing*
While i dont think Ryze needs another tear item to stack He also doesnt benift from the passive because of how his skill cost no mana in the first place.

It's a start. I like the idea of having armor and mr on it, but I think the active might be a bit OP.

Maybe instead it could give an AoE shield based on your max mana? How mad do you think people would be if this replaced locket? :P

As a melee champion who would build this i dont want everything to be for my team i need things to help me as a champion. Adcs dont have any items that make allies better. Mages dont either but tanks and bruisers are expected to build everything to buff other classes and not themselves.

Yeah, proposition would definitely be for a support item.

Do you want FH to be an item for traditional tanks? I, for one, would like a few more items for tanky supports, and FH has been cast into that role already imo.

I think the transformed item's active should toggle a defensive aura (visually producing snow particles) that consumes 10 mana +2% current mana per second with a 20 second reactivation cooldown, and with a defensive debuff (it could still reduce attack speed or something else) slightly ramping up based on the total amount of mana consumed and the amount of time that enemies spend inside the aura.  The aura could also provide the user with a small amount of ramping up armor/shield so that it can feel impactful without needing to severely debuff enemies.

I think the item should still build from {{item:3024}} but the CDR could be reduced to 10%.

"very strong situational item" its never even built in pro play with coordinated teams that relay on team fights to win games so no it isn't a strong situational item, its a trash item even in the perfect situation.

*Very* few of the League games played are played professionally. It's common knowledge that there are champions that are fine in lower elos that suck in pros; is that so hard to believe for an item? It can suck in pros and still be good for the rest of us in some situations.
yes it is for aura items that get much less value in soloQ than they do in pro play, tell me one reason why it would ever be better in soloQ than in pro play.

Allied auras get less value in solo Q than pro play. This isn't an ally aura. It's an enemy aura, so *your* team doesn't have to be grouped up to use it.

It's good when the enemy picks Tryndamere, Jax, Yasuo, and a traditional adc, all of whom do lots of physical damage *and* care (at least a little) about attack speed. It can keep a tank support tanky and also help your squishy allies live a bit longer. It can be a great item in that scenario.

the enemy team is also way more likely to be grouped up in pro play and considering the team comps its far more likely that the guy with the frozen heart actually affects more people than it does in soloQ.

its straight up horrible against jax and yasuo, with tryndamere it depends on whether his running ad or ap but since the current meta is ap its horrible against him as well, yet to see a single reason as to why it would ever be better in soloQ than competitive though.
... Why do you think reducing Jax and Yasuo's attack speed is terrible?

jaxs laning is combo based trading which attack speed doesn't affect much at all (hence why jax went from botrk rush to titanic + trinity), also the fact that he has a mix of true, magic and physical damage makes buying a full on armor item with no health or magic resist terrible, in team fights he will again combo someone in your back line rather than spend a lot of time auto attacking. 

its bad against yasuo because ya know randuins is just much better against someone with massive armor pen, some true damage and a 100% crit chance so there is never any reason to build frozen against yasuo before 4~ items and games don't even go to 4 items.

If the game *does* go to 4 items, though, and I already have randuin's, it's a good item to add. Maybe even if I don't have Randuin's; if my goal is to survive the Jax/Yas, sure, your argument makes sense. I don't think FH makes sense as a solo item.

Against an attack speed heavy comp, though, I maintain that a tanky support can build this item and get something nice from it. Not nice enough, perhaps, but the concept is there.

I mean a support won't have the item slot for it so it would pretty much have to be a solo lane tank and 99 times out of a 100 there is a better alternative for them, but i guess if the enemy team comp really makes no sense and is running something like cait, kaisa, yasuo teemo it could be a good item as a 4th or 5th item, not that this will ever happen at any elo where people care about their lp but ya know.

Well, you find people in all elos that don't really care about their lp. Anyone who plays bronze-plat, at least, knows this to be true. And I hear it's still true in diamond, but I can't attest to that. 

Like, yeah, it's not the best at high tiers of play. You won't hear me argue that point. But I do, occasionally, get a braindead all AD enemy comp with 3 marksmen on it. For some reason.

Other things provide AS slow that also do a lot more

If you need an AoE AS slow Randuins has you covered, has an actual slow, and gives HP
If you don't care about the AoE, Thornmail also prevents a lot more damage given its 100 armor and health and it hurts people who attack you

If Frozen Heart had HP it might actually compete with Randuins for an item slot.  The amount of mana/cdr isn't enough to justify it over Gauntlet either.  Like really all it comes down to is every good aspect of the item is done better by a different item, the only benefit is you can get Frozen Heart + one of these better items together to get a potent combo, but that's also only good against full AD/AS teams.
Problem being that it doesn't provide any HP which is suicidal right now because of the amount of true damage - namely conqueror and such.
I only build it when the enemy team has a Vayne since the ONLY counterplay to the dumbest thing in the game, %hp true damage, is slowing it down.
its not even a true counter because it doesn't affect {{champion:114}} 's %true damage.
I sometimes build it on nasus and malphite
I get it to cap CDR if I run triforce because RG just doesn't do it for me.

You are wasting gold on spellblade if you get both Triforce and IBG.  It is a unique passive so it only applies the greatest one.  The primary target gets hit by 200% base damage from Triforce and the ice field does 100%.  There are very few instances when you actually care about the AoE damage with Iceborn.  It is mostly to do damage to the primary target.

By that point, the IBG spellblade is mostly useless because Triforce gives you enough sticking power by itself with 5% plus 20-60 flat movement speed.  I don't think anybody really cares about the AoE damage from IBG unless they are going full tank with 600 armor and the AoE covers half the lane.  If sticking to people is your concern, you would be much better off just going IBG by itself or getting Triforce with a Righteous Glory.

In my opinion {{item:3143}}  stats suck too much to consider buying {{item:3075}}  stats and Passives suck too much You dont even need this to do anything to bruisers but it does nothing to adcs because they removed the damage reflect. 250 hp was not enough to make up Removing 20 armor when the change was supposed to buff the item and they removed its 2 best portions before the stuff they added the amount of armor it had and the damage reflect it had.
You buy Frozen Heart into an AD matchup for the mana/cdr and then instantly transition into HP. It is not an item you buy solely for tankiness.

In my experience Frozen heart helps with mana as much as  2 {{item:1004}} 's

a lot of top pyke players will rush it in conjunction with cleaver for the mana sustain and tankiness it provides him
I often buy frozen heart on Malphite though.

I buy it all the time. Works extremely well with {{item:3003}} {{item:3004}} builds, or champs like {{champion:555}} who cannot gain HP.

It's a major item on the following champs, imo:

{{champion:34}} {{champion:28}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:516}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:223}} 

And you can counter its lack of stats by running Transcendence. Then it's a 52 AP item.

Sometimes it's the only item you can get to stay on pace with damage while negating "SOME" of the AD damage coming at you, which allows you to assassinate someone who would kill you before they can.

For example, {{champion:28}}  vs {{champion:15}}  or {{champion:28}} vs {{champion:18}} or {{champion:28}} vs {{champion:236}} when the adcs are fed beyond what Evelynn can deal with if she doesn't have a charm to rely on.

I get it on Anivia for the extra mana, and resistances. Plus, with transcendence and Archangel, it gives a tonne of AP as well. It's actually saved me in a 1v1 against a Camille, and I just know that extra aura effect helps in team fights slightly.

Yes, IMO it's good on Mages that want to go hybrid damage with {{item:3042}} but that's about the only time I get it. And even that is rare. The item needs some love. But I'm afraid any change they make to it would make it even worse. Part of the problem I'm willing to buy {{item:3025}} on just about anyone and {{item:3143}} is mandatory more often than not. Celerity is so good, I feel like Transcendence needs a buff to keep up. 2 AP per 1 CDR over 40 is just not going to be competitive enough IMHO.
